intro: Omphalocarpum vermoesenii, commonly known as the yellow sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of southern Africa. It is characterized by its small, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, typically during the warmer months. The plant has a compact, bushy growth habit with hairy stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Omphalocarpum vermoesenii plays a role in supporting local pollinators and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats.
